intro: Serapias lingua var. longebracteata, commonly known as the long-bract serapias, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with red markings. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and thrives in sunny, well-drained environments. Its leaves are basal and lobed, while its stems are erect and branched. The variety is noted for its elongated bracts, which give it its specific epithet.
